titleStmt.title: William V. Archer to James R. Page
CWG1959

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
LEDYARD & BARLOW,
SUCCESSORS TO
DAVIS & BIRNEY,
WM. W. LEDYARD.
WM. M. BARLOW.
Attorney at Law.
WM. V. ARCHER,
Commissioner of Deeds.

LAW AND COLLECTION OFFICE,
(429 Chestnut St., Farmers' and Mechanics. Bank.)
Philadelphia, Sep 30 1864

James R Page Eq
Fankfort Ky
Dear Sir

Your esteemed favor has been received advising me that my commission for Kentucky has expired Will you please send me the renewal by an early mail. I had overlooked the fact that my commission would expire the 10th Inst until your letter was received Be good enough to date the renewal Sep 10th that no interupnance may occur
I will take it as a very great favor if you will send my Commission by an early mail
Enclose you will find fee of $5 as requested

Pennsylvania
Comr Deeds
Wm V. Archer
apptd
10th Sept/64
